page.title: 04FARMING IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: Mixed arable farming is the main type of agriculture practised in the area. The main crops grown are cereals,sugar beet,potatoes,peas,strawberries and carrots.Some farmers also have a few over wintered cattle. Farmers tend to practice a three year crop rotation.Crops are sold to which ever representative offers the best price. Most farms are highly mechanised through all stages of crop development.Ploughs,tractors,combine harvesters,balers,drillers and sprayers are all familiar sights.Each machine can cost several thousand pounds.Employment tends to be confined to the family (normally father and son) with the farmers wife helping at peak harvest time.In addition casual workers are employed for large,short lived harvests like strawberries.
